definition: to report bad news/to announce failure, shortcoming or disaster
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning
to report only the good news, not the bad news/to hold back unpleasant news/to sweep bad news under the carpet

sentences.english: Our Chineseare are good at tell the good news, not but the bad news.
sentences.chinese: 我们中国人最擅长的，便是报喜不报忧。

sentences.english: Every15-year-old boy tells his mother is fine.
sentences.chinese: 任何一个十五岁的男孩对他妈妈总是报喜不报忧。

sentences.english: You love your home, in the back just unpleasant.
sentences.chinese: 你爱家，在外回来只报喜不报忧。

sentences.english: And there are lots of good things happening, they just don't make the news.
sentences.chinese: 更多的好事正在发生，只不过媒体是报忧不报喜。

definition: to report only the good news, not the bad news/to hold back unpleasant news/to sweep bad news under the carpet
to pretend that everything is going well
to sing the high part/to speak fine sounding but empty words (idiom)
to show off one's accomplishments (often derog.)
to stir up trouble
if you say too much, you're bound to slip up at some point (idiom)
unpleasant talk/malicious words
hiding a sickness for fear of treatment (idiom); fig. concealing a fault to avoid criticism/to keep one's shortcomings secret/to refuse to listen to advice
homesick
(coll.) to tattletale/to rat on sb
to make public/to disclose
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
to blame/to criticize/condemnation/reproach
to prattle/to chatter away/to nag/garrulous/nagging
to whine/to be grouchy
to be criticized/to suffer blame
